text: The 2019 Erovnuli Liga or Crystalbet Erovnuli Liga 2019 (formerly known as Umaglesi Liga) was the 31st season of top-tier football in Georgia. Saburtalo Tbilisi were the defending champions. The season began on 1 March 2019 and ended on 1 December 2019. ==Teams and stadiums== {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- ! Team !! Location !! Venue !! Capacity |- | Chikhura Sachkhere || Sachkhere || ||align="center"|2,000 |- | Dila Gori || Gori || Tengiz Burjanadze Stadium ||align="center"|8,230 |- | Dinamo Batumi || Batumi || Chele Arena ||align="center"|6,000 |- | Dinamo Tbilisi || Tbilisi || Boris Paichadze Stadium ||align="center"|54,549 |- | Locomotive Tbilisi || Tbilisi || Mikheil Meskhi Stadium ||align="center"|27,223 |- | FC Rustavi || Rustavi || Poladi Stadium ||align="center"|10,720 |- | Saburtalo Tbilisi || Tbilisi || Mikheil Meskhi Stadium ||align="center"|27,223 |- | Sioni Bolnisi || Bolnisi || Tamaz Stepania Stadium ||align="center"|3,242 |- | Torpedo Kutaisi || Kutaisi || Ramaz Shengelia Stadium ||align="center"|19,400 |- | WIT Georgia || Mtskheta || Mtskheta Park ||align="center"|2,000 |} ==League table== ==Results== Each team will play the other nine teams home and away twice, for a total of 36 games each. ===First half of season=== ===Second half of season=== ==Relegation play-offs== \---- ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |1 |align="left"| Levan Kutalia |align="left"|Dinamo Tbilisi |19 |- |2 |align="left"| Flamarion |align="left"|Dinamo Batumi |16 |- |rowspan=2|3 |align="left"| Budu Zivzivadze |align="left"|Torpedo Kutaisi |13 |- |align="left"| Irakli Sikharulidze |align="left"|Locomotive Tbilisi |13 |- |5 |align="left"| Levan Shengelia |align="left"|Dinamo Tbilisi |12 |- |rowspan=2|6 |align="left"| Gega Diasamidze |align="left"|Saburtalo Tbilisi |rowspan=2|11 |- |align="left"| Nodar Kavtaradze |align="left"|Dinamo Tbilisi |- |8 |align="left"| Lasha Shindagoridze |align="left"|Saburtalo Tbilisi |10 |- |rowspan=2|9 |align="left"| Bidzina Makharoblidze |align="left"|Chikhura Sachkhere |rowspan=2|9 |- |align="left"| Jaba Ugulava |align="left"|Sioni Bolnisi |} ==References== Category:Erovnuli Liga seasons 1 1 Georgia Georgia
